climbs.name: Werner's Crack
climbs.fa: Werner Braun and Bruce Steakly, June 1971

content.description:
The first pitch climbs either a short, 5.7, lieback or an unprotected knobby face to a ledge.  Belay.

The second pitch climbs the prominent left-arching crack which starts out as 1", but widens to 6" as it nears the belay.
content.protection: Protection up to a #3 Camalot.  Additional wide pro up to a #4 Camalot helps up higher.
content.location:
This route is located just left of the Prude.  Look for a left-arching crack which gets wider up higher and ends at a bush/tree.

Rappel from the top, 150', to the base.

Condition Note: this route was destroyed by rockfall and is no longer climbable in it's original form.  It is listed here purely for historical purposes (it was a fun route!)

content.description: This is a fun crack climb with a face crux to reach it.
content.protection: Bring gear up to a #3 Camalot.
content.location:
There are two major slabs which constitute this area.  The Prude is on the northern slab in the middle.  It starts just right of Werner's Crack.

Climb a short face(crux) to reach a right arching crack.  Follow that for about 130'(some spots of 5.7) to the belay.  Rappel 150' back to the base.
